title: Inside Europe 09.06.2022
description: The urgency to unblock Ukraine’s grain exports: Turkey and Poland step up efforts to stave off global food insecurity. Also, can digital nomads keep Venice afloat? An environmentally friendly car that’s cheap and assembling it is child’s play. The Russian journalists who’ve fled to Latvia. From acclaim to obscurity, the Australian violinist who inspired Europe’s composers 100 years ago. And more
itunes:author: DW.COM | Deutsche Welle
itunes:keywords: Inside Europe, Helen Seeney, Ukrainian grain, Venice, gazelle, Russian media, Ukrainian refugees, alma moodie, Lithuanian, climate change
